story.text: TORONTO Jan 3 The main index of the Toronto Stock Exchange dropped more than 100 points on Wednesday morning, as investors drove down resource and energy shares on weakness in the underlying commodities. The S&P/TSX composite index fell 101.01 points, or 0.8 percent, to 12,822.65 shortly before 11 a.m., erasing the modest 15-point gain booked in Tuesday's session.
story.title: toronto stocks dive on weak resources , energy
